header: update 1-jp morgan raises choice hotels to neutral
body:
Oct 28 (Reuters) - J.P. Morgan Securities upgraded Choice Hotels International Inc (CHH.N) to “neutral” from “underweight,” citing reasonable valuation, a strengthening balance sheet and less negative operating leverage.

“We now view the shares as an even risk-reward within our coverage universe, despite low visibility on forward travel trends,” JP Morgan analyst Joseph Greff wrote in a note.

Shares of the operator of Comfort Inn and other budget lodging chains have lost 25 percent of their value in the last one month, while the S&P 500 .SPX has lost about 30 percent during the period.

“While we are not advocating buying the stock at these levels we would not be short here either,” Greff said.

Shares of Silver Spring, Maryland-based Choice Hotels, whose brands also include Econo Lodge and Extended Stay Hotel, closed at $20.86 Monday on the New York Stock Exchange. (Reporting by Anand Basu in Bangalore; Editing by Himani Sarkar)
